name: jardiniere
content:
jardiniere noun [C]
(CONTAINER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a decorative container that holds plants: A beautiful clay jardiniere stood in the corner of the room. She bought a turquoise enamel jardinière to show off her agave plant.
More examplesFewer examplesPlanters for pot plants can be plain, but if you really want to make an impression, it's worth choosing a more stylish, decorated jardiniere.Pot plants often come in quite ugly flowerpots so it's a good idea to put them in a jardiniere.

jardiniere noun [C]
(VEGETABLES)
a dish of cooked chopped vegetables, served with another dish: The roast lamb came with a jardiniere of celery, carrot, and green beans. The next dish was a jardinière of spring vegetables.
More examplesFewer examplesHe prepared a jardiniere of glazed spring vegetables as a garnish.I finely chopped the carrots, peppers, and celery and mixed them with seasoning to make a jardiniere.Jardiniere is one of those fancy names for what is essentially just mixed vegetables.
